Name: Board of Directors - Acceptance and Commitment
Description: The board of directors should accept the responsibility of information security and present commitment towards it.

Name: Board of Directors - Overseeing the Information Security Program
Description: The entity's board of directors is assigned the responsibility of overseeing a properly managed and implemented information security program/management system and reviewing risk assessment reports.

Name: Director General / CEO - Accept & Endorse
Description: The CEO or Director General who might be reporting to the board of directors has responsibility for accepting and endorsing the overall responsibility of information security.

Name: Director General / CEO - Enforce ISMS
Description: The CEO or Director General who might be reporting to the board of directors has responsibility for enforcing organization wide information security management system.

Name: Director General / CEO - Enforce Information Security Policies
Description: The CEO or Director General who might be reporting to the board of directors has responsibility for enforcing information security policies implementation across the entity.

Name: Director General / CEO - Overseeing & Monitoring
Description: The CEO or Director General who might be reporting to the board of directors has responsibility for overseeing and monitoring divisions compliance to information security management system and information security policies.

Name: Director General / CEO - Enforcing Accountability
Description: The CEO or Director General who might be reporting to the board of directors has responsibility for enforcing accountability towards information security

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Establishment
Description: An information security steering committee, headed by Director General or deputy, should be established and should include heads from each division in the entity.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Supervise
Description: The steering committee should supervise and ensure the implementation of an Information Security Management System

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Periodical Implementation Reviews
Description: The steering committee should conduct periodical reviews on the implementation of Information Security Regulation and any information security controls and objectives.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Review & Approve
Description: The steering committee should review and approve periodically the information security policies and procedures for implementation within the entity.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Promote Culture Change
Description: The steering committee should promote Information Security culture within Entity

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Integrate with Business Processes
Description: The steering committee should ensure that relevant information security methodologies are part of all business processes and any new initiatives or projects across all the entity departments or functions.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Follow up & Review Audits
Description: The steering committee should follow up and review both internal and external audits results for effectiveness of Information Security Regulation implementation and ensure necessary and timely corrective actions are taken.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Review & Approve Risk Assessment Methodology
Description: The steering committee should review and approve the information security risk assessment methodology and risk assessment related results that is used across the entity.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Provide ISMS Resources
Description: The steering committee should ensure that adequate resources are provided to implement, support and operate the information security management system.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Provide ISR Resources
Description: The steering committee should ensure that adequate resources are provided for ISR Implementation

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Recommend Corrective & Preventive Actions
Description: The steering committee should make recommendations for both corrective and preventive actions based on the risk assessment approach.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Review Incidents
Description: The steering committee should review the Information Security Incidents and their responses

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Review Implementation of Committee Recommendations
Description: The steering committee should ensure that recommendations approved by the committee are implemented.

Name: Information Security Steering Committee - Review Integration of IS Requirements in Contracts
Description: The steering committee should ensure that Information Security requirements are integrated as part of contractual requirements in their respective project management activities.

Name: Senior Management - Ensure Staff Understand Their Responsibilities
Description: The entity's senior management should ensure that each employee understands his/her information security related responsibilities after reading the information security policy and acknowledges through a formal sign-off that he/she understands and intends to comply with those requirements.

Name: Senior Management - Determine Criticality & Business Risk
Description: The entity's senior management should determine the criticality and business risk of their information systems and information assets

Name: Senior Management - Periodic Assessment of Information Assets
Description: The entity's senior management should periodically assess information assets and their associated risks.

Name: Senior Management - Communicate the Risk Assessment Results
Description: The entity's senior management should communicate the risk assessment results to relevant stakeholders.

Name: Senior Management - Determine & Review Privileges
Description: The entity's senior management should determine and review the privileges related to their information assets and information systems on a periodic basis.

Name: Senior Management - Implement Policies and Procedures
Description: The entity's senior management should implement information security policies and procedures to cost-effectively reduce risk to acceptable levels.

Name: Senior Management - Ensure Conducting Technical Testing
Description: The entity's senior management should periodically, ensure conducting technical security testing on the information systems.

Name: Senior Management - Report Any Compromise
Description: The entity's senior management should ensure reporting of any evidence of information security compromise or any suspicious activity that could potentially expose, corrupt or destroy entitys information.

Name: Senior Management - Respond to Information Security Incidents
Description: The entity's senior management should respond to information security incidents.

Name: Senior Management - Ensure Including Information Security Requirements in Project Activities & Contracts.
Description: The entity's senior management should ensure that information security requirements are incorporated on respective departments project activities/contracts.

Name: Information Security Position - Implement & Maintain an ISMS Program
Description: The information security position should plan, implement and maintain an information security program/management system integrated with the whole entitys processes.

Name: Information Security Position - Coordination with Management
Description: The information security position should coordinate with the senior management on the identification and development of up to date entity wide information assets register.

Name: Information Security Position - Plan & Review an IS Risk Assessment Methodology
Description: The information security position should plan, develop, review and update an organization wide information security risk assessment methodology.

Name: Information Security Position - Select & Implement Controls
Description: The information security position should ensure that appropriate operational controls are selected and implemented according to the results of the risk assessment.

Name: Information Security Position - Develop Policies & Procedures
Description: The information security position should develop the required policies, and procedures.

Name: Information Security Position - Ensure Compliance with ISR
Description: The information security position should ensure organization wide compliance to the ISR and report non-compliance to the IS steering committee

Name: Information Security Position - Support Senior Management
Description: The information security position should assist and support senior management with their information security responsibilities.

Name: Information Security Position - Conduct Awareness
Description: The information security position should plan and conduct periodic information security awareness, training and education.

Name: Employees - Champions
Description: Senior management assigns the coordination of information security activities to certain employees acting as Information security champions/ representatives/coordinators across all divisions.

Name: Employees - Responsibilities of all Staff
Description: The entity assigns all employees responsible for adhering to the information security policies/processes/program and for reporting any security breaches or incidents to their direct management.

Name: Information Security Policy Document - Develop & Maintain an Information Security Policy
Description: Develops, distributes and maintains an entity-wide information security policy outlining the basic principles of protecting all the information assets of the entity, and make all employees within the entity and relevant external parties aware of the potential security threats and associated business risks.

Name: Information Security Policy Document - Approval on Information Security Policy
Description: Ensure the Information security policy is approved by top management, published and communicated to employees and relevant external parties.

Name: Information Security Policy Alignment with the Entity Strategy
Description: Aligns the information security policy with the entity overall strategy to facilitate the implementation of the entity's goals and objectives, and to support its business model without setting any obstacles in implementing them.

Name: Review of Information Security Policy - Responsibility of Regular Review
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set a clear responsibility for a regular review of the information security policy to be conducted at least once a year, and/or along with any changes that the entity might undergo.

Name: Review of Information Security Policy - Report to Steering Committee
Description: Dubai Government Entity should report any update or review of the information security policy to the Information Security Steering Committee and sets the declaration of changes to the entity's CEO/Director General.

Name: Technical and Operational Policies - Develop & Maintain Supporting Policies
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a set of technical/operational information security policies that covers the required security protection measures and controls based on the results of the risk assessment and depicts the overall responsibility of all stakeholders in safeguarding the respective business process related information assets.

Name: Technical and Operational Policies - Develop & Maintain Supporting Procedures
Description: Dubai Government Entity should supplements the entity's technical/operational policies, as necessary, with a set of procedures and guidelines that cover the implementation details of the policies in accordance with the risk assessment results.

Name: Information Security Awareness and Training - Develop a Program
Description: Dubai Government Entity should design, develop, and implement an information security awareness program.

Name: Information Security Awareness and Training - Conduct Awareness
Description: Dubai Government Entity should provide basic information security training and awareness to all personnel within the entity.

Name: Information Security Awareness and Training - Technical Training
Description: Dubai Government Entity should provide adequate information security trainings for the employees of information security management system within their respective business areas.

Name: Information Security Awareness and Training - Awareness Based on Risks
Description: Dubai Government Entity should design the information security awareness materials to be in accordance to the entity's daily business operation's security risks, focusing on reducing possible risks.

Name: Information Security Awareness and Training - Awareness Surveys
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop continuous security awareness surveys to measure the awareness level of all personnel,  to improve the overall awareness program

Name: Information Security Awareness and Training - Record Attendance
Description: Dubai Government Entity should document information security training and awareness attendance records for all personnel/

Name: Confidentiality Agreements - Develop & Review NDA
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, and regularly review a non-disclosure or confidentiality agreement which is signed by all employees and external parties, that addresses in legally enforceable terms, the need for protecting the Government information from being leaked internally or externally, and emphasizing the «need to know» concept.

Name: Confidentiality Agreements - Educate About NDA
Description: Dubai Government Entity should educate personnel and makes them aware of the confidentiality of government information and how information leakage, written or spoken, can impact the entity.

Name: Relations and Sustainability of Information Security - Contacts with Authorities
Description: Dubai Government Entity should maintain appropriate contacts with relevant authorities within the field of information security.

Name: Relations and Sustainability of Information Security - Contacts with Judicial Authorities
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify key contacts of certain security and judicial authorities to be contacted in the cases of information security incidents, breaches, etc.

Name: Relations and Sustainability of Information Security - Interest Groups
Description: Dubai Government Entity should maintain contacts and memberships with information security interest groups, forums and associations.

Name: Securing External Parties Relations - Assess Risks
Description: Dubai Government Entity should determine and assess governance and information security risks related to its relations with external parties, such as customers, external party services providers, business consultants, temporary employments, etc. This also includes outsourcing and cloud services providers.

Name: Securing External Parties Relations - Apply Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should select and apply the appropriate information security controls and measures to control the identified risks.

Name: Securing External Parties Relations - Security Agreements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and implement the required agreements to secure relations with the external parties, including integrity, availability and confidentiality.

Name: Information Assets Management - Develop Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain an entity wide information asset management policy and procedure or framework for the identification, management and protection of information assets in line with applicable laws and regulations.

Name: Information Assets Management - Asset Register
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify, document, and maintain a register of all critical information assets for the entire entity, including the information and data assets and the related information processing facilities and components, such as software assets, people assets, physical assets, etc. and consider other details such as, information classification, physical location, license details, business value, and any other necessary information that may be required to avoid risks and recover from disasters.

Name: Information Assets Management - Review & Maintain Asset Register
Description: Dubai Government Entity should review & maintain the information asset register on a regular basis.

Name: Information Assets Ownership/Custodianship - Information Ownership Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should establish and implement information ownership policy, where information assets are identified with an owner and a custodian

Name: Information Assets Ownership/Custodianship - Information Classification Responsibility
Description: Dubai Government Entity should assign the information assets owner the responsibility of ensuring that proper classifications of information are carried out based on the sensitivity of information.

Name: Information Assets Ownership/Custodianship - Access Control Responsibility
Description: Dubai Government Entity should assign the information assets owner the responsibility of defining the proper access control to the information and ensuring periodic review of access in accordance with assigned classification level and the entitys access control policy.

Name: Information Assets Ownership/Custodianship - Responsibility of Custodians
Description: Dubai Government Entity should assign the custodians the responsibility of maintaining the day to day operational tasks related to the information assets, while considering the higher authority of the assets by the owners.

Name: Information Assets Classification - Information Classification Scheme
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define and implement an information classification scheme/process based on assets criticality, value, legal and protection requirements, etc.

Name: Information Assets Classification - Information Classification Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain information classification policy and related procedures.

Name: Information Assets Labelling and Handling - Labelling & Handling Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define and implement adequate labelling and handling controls for the information assets (electronic and physical); according to the requirements of each classification level, considering the handling requirements, storage procedures, distribution limitations, etc., for each information asset.

Name: Information Assets Labelling and Handling - Procedure for Labeling & Handling
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain procedure for the information assets labelling and handling requirements.

Name: Disposals of Information and Assets - Prior to Disposal
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify and implement the required safety and security measures prior to the disposal of information assets based on their value, criticality and sensitivity.

Name: Disposals of Information and Assets - Information Disposal Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain clear procedure for  disposal of information and information assets, as part of the labelling and handling procedure

Name: Information Assets Responsibility - Acceptable Use Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain an acceptable use policy governing the acceptable use of information and assets including usage of personal devices in entitys environment.

Name: Risk Assessment Methodology & Planning - Risk Assessment Methodology
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop a risk assessment methodology that aligns with the requirements of the entitys information security program/management system.

Name: Risk Assessment Methodology & Planning - Risk Assessment Plan
Description: Dubai Government Entity should determine a periodic plan for conducting the risk assessment across the entity.

Name: Risk Assessment Methodology & Planning - Risk Acceptance Criteria
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify the criteria of acceptable risks as part of the risk assessment methodology.

Name: Risk Assessment Methodology & Planning - Risk Assessment Scope
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify the scope of the risk assessments, in terms of the business processes & respective information assets that will be included in the assessment.

Name: Risk Assessment Methodology & Planning - Identify Threats & Vulnerabilities
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify threats and vulnerabilities pertaining to the identified assets.

Name: Risk Assessment Methodology & Planning - Risk Assessment Program Awareness
Description: Dubai Government Entity should plan and implement a periodic awareness of the risk assessment program across the entity.

Name: Risk Assessment - Conduct Risk Assessment
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct & maintain a detailed risk assessment in accordance with the approved risk assessment methodology.

Name: Risk Assessment - Risk Analysis
Description: Dubai Government Entity should analyze risks and prioritizes them based on the criticality, in order to set treatment plans and controls.

Name: Risk Assessment - Risk Acceptance
Description: Dubai Government Entity should determine and identify the acceptable risks in accordance with the risk assessment methodology.

Name: Risk Assessment - Approval of Risk Assessment Results
Description: Dubai Government Entity should document the risk assessment results and approves it officially by the senior management or the Information Security Steering Committee.

Name: Risk Treatment and Mitigation - Risk Treatment Options
Description: Dubai Government Entity should select the proper risk treatment plans (mitigate, avoid, transfer, etc.) for the identified risks.

Name: Risk Treatment and Mitigation - Select Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should determine and select the appropriate security operational controls for mitigating the identified risks.

Name: Risk Treatment and Mitigation - Authority for Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should sign off and authorize officially the implementation of the risk mitigations controls.

Name: Risk Treatment and Mitigation - Implement Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should perform and implement the mitigation controls for the risks identified.

Name: Risk Treatment and Mitigation - Risk Monitoring
Description: Dubai Government Entity should review and monitor the implemented risk mitigation controls for effectiveness.

Name: Risk Acceptance - Residual Risks
Description: Dubai Government Entity should document the residual non treated risks with justifications and gets it signed off from the Information Security Steering Committee along with the detailed plan for treatment at a later date.

Name: Incident Management Planning - Develop of Incident Management Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal policy and procedure for the management of information security incidents.

Name: Incident Management Planning - Incident Response Team
Description: Dubai Government Entity should establish a capability (incident response team) for the information security incidents response and handling across the entity.

Name: Incident Management Planning - Incident Response Awareness & Training
Description: Dubai Government Entity should provide periodic awareness and training sessions to Incident Response Team on incident handling process in order to exercise & execute effective handling of information security incidents.

Name: Information Security Incident Reporting & Escalation - Reporting Incidents
Description: Dubai Government Entity should assign responsibility to all employees or any users dealing with the entitys information, for reporting  information security incidents or weaknesses.

Name: Information Security Incident Reporting & Escalation - Escalation Process
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement an escalation process for reporting information security incidents identified as high severity, engage external authorities for investigation, if required.

Name: Evidence Gathering - Digital Evidence
Description: Dubai Government Entity should gather and retain any evidences related to any information security incidents.

Name: Information Security Incidents Knowledge Base - Develop Knowledge Base
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop a knowledge base for security incidents with details of any previous incidents, their types, cost, and any other relevant information.

Name: Access Control Management Policy/Procedure - Access Control Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain an access control policy that addresses all security requirements for the implementation of an effective access control within the entity.

Name: Access Control Management Policy/Procedure - Access Control Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain an access control procedure that provides implementation details for access control, based on role-bases access control.

Name: Access Control Management Policy/Procedure - Secure Repository of All Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should maintain a secure repository of all information systems access controls.

Name: Users Access Control - User Registration & De-Registration
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define and Implement a process for users registration, de-registration, and users access privileges modification, disabling or removal, etc.

Name: Users Access Control - User ID
Description: Dubai Government Entity should provide each user with a unique identifier (user ID) for their individual business use only.

Name: Users Access Control - User ID Standard
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement a unified users ID standard across the entity.

Name: Users Access Control - Authentication Technique
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement a proper authentication technique for the validation of users access,  onsite and remote.

Name: Users Access Control - Authentication Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain appropriate authentication policy(ies) (e.g. a password allocation process, users' responsibilities, password structure, etc.).

Name: Users Access Control - Special Privilege Access
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should identify the categories of users requiring regular and special privileges through ensuring the availability of the following:
A-A valid and approved access authorization
B-Intended system usage
C-Other attributes as required by the entity
D-Utilization of access accounts with special privileges must be restricted for their intended purpose

Name: Users Access Control - Privilege Access Records
Description: Dubai Government Entity should maintain records of all users' access privileges, and monitors them on a continuous basis.

Name: Users Access Control - Limit High Privileged Users
Description: Dubai Government Entity should limit the number of special/high privileged user IDs to those individuals who absolutely must have such privileges for authorized business purposes.

Name: Users Access Control - Monitor High Privileged Users
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper security and independent monitoring controls over the usage of special or high privileged IDs

Name: Users Access Control - Temporary Users
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper process for guest and temporary user IDs request and employs automated user IDs termination.

Name: Users Access Control - Least Privilege
Description: Dubai Government Entity should allocate access privileges on a restricted basis while employing least privilege concept and separation of duties.

Name: Users Access Control - Re-authorization Process
Description: Dubai Government Entity should employ a process for review and re-authorization of user access rights on a periodic basis, as defined by the entity.

Name: Network Access Control - Network Access Control Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a policy for network access control, networks services, authorization process for granting network access, etc.

Name: Network Access Control - Network Connection Authorization
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define a process for authorizing, activating and terminating any network connections in the entity.

Name: Network Access Control - Network Access Control Tool
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement network access control tool/method for network connectivity detection, identification and authentication.

Name: Network Access Control - Remote Access Control
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper authentication tool for remote access connections.

Name: Network Access Control - Configuration Ports
Description: Dubai Government Entity should manage and control access to configuration ports on network equipment/devices.

Name: Network Access Control - Segregation Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper segregation controls on the different types of networks (internal, external, wireless, IP telephony, etc.).

Name: Network Access Control - Network Security Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper security and operational controls for any network connections beyond the entitys direct control.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Access to Operating Systems
Description: Dubai Government Entity should manage and control access to operating systems through secure log-on process.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Unique User ID
Description: Dubai Government Entity should assign each user with a unique user ID and apply the proper authentication method for identity verification.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Limit Generic IDs
Description: Dubai Government Entity should limit the use of generic user IDs to only exceptional and business justified circumstances, and implements the proper accountability technique for such use.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Authentication Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement an entity wide authentication mechanism to enforce various authentication controls.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Use of Utility Programs
Description: Dubai Government Entity should manage and control the use of utility programs.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Session Time-out
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement session time-out controls to prevent unauthorized access.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Lockout Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement lock-out policy.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Restrict Connection Times
Description: Dubai Government Entity should restrict connection times for critical information systems and applications.

Name: Operating System Access Control - Log Review
Description: Dubai Government Entity should record and continuously review logs of administrators system IDs.

Name: Applications Access Control - Role Based Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should provide access to applications based on job responsibilities and business justifications, in alignment with the entity access control policy/procedure.

Name: Applications Access Control - Isolation Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper physical or logical isolation controls for highly critical information systems and application environments.

Name: Remote Access Security - Remote Access Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a policy addressing remote access to the entity's resources.

Name: Remote Access Security - Remote Access Authorization
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enforce formal authorization prior to remote access connections.

Name: Remote Access Security - VPN Client
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure that adequate security controls are implemented on the VPN client machines, such as authentication, encryption, antivirus software, personal firewalls, session timeout, etc.

Name: Remote Access Security - Limited Remote Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should provide remote access users with access to the services that they have been specifically authorized to use.

Name: Remote Access Security - Monitor Remote Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should monitor and periodically review the remote access connections logs.

Name: Mobile Computing - Mobile Computing Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal policy governing the appropriate use of mobile computing and communication facilities.

Name: Mobile Computing - Implement Encryption
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement appropriate security controls to protect against the risks of mobile computing and communication facilities usage, such as:
A-Implement encryption mechanisms

Name: Mobile Computing - Handling Portable Devices
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement appropriate security controls to protect against the risks of mobile computing and communication facilities usage, such as:
B-Secure handling for the portable computing devices

Name: Mobile Computing - Disable Lost Devices
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement appropriate security controls to protect against the risks of mobile computing and communication facilities usage, such as:
C-Mechanisms to disable portable devices when lost or stolen.

Name: Mobile Computing - Backup of Portable Devices
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement appropriate security controls to protect against the risks of mobile computing and communication facilities usage, such as:
D-Proper data backup procedures for the portable devices

Name: Mobile Computing - Limit Use of Portable Devices
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement appropriate security controls to protect against the risks of mobile computing and communication facilities usage, such as: 
E- Limit or restrict usage of portable computing devices to authorized users with adequate security controls.

Name: Mobile Computing - BYOD
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a policy and procedure for the handling and usage of personally owned devices (Bring your own Device (BYOD)) that are not owned by the entity, addressing entitys security requirements on handling lost or stolen portable computing devices, storage of entity data on these devices, connectivity to entity network and systems etc.

Name: Wireless Access Management - Wireless Security Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal policy on the wireless network usage.

Name: Wireless Access Management - Authorize Wireless Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should authorize formally the wireless access to the network prior to any connection.

Name: Wireless Access Management - Wireless Access Authentication
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement the proper authentication controls for the wireless access.

Name: Wireless Access Management - Wireless Security Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enforce proper security controls for wireless connections to the entity's network and establishes usage restrictions and implementation guidance for such use.

Name: Wireless Access Management - Access to Specific Services
Description: Dubai Government Entity should provide wireless connection users with access to services that they have been specifically authorized to use.

Name: Wireless Access Management - Monitor Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should monitor continuously the unauthorized wireless access to the network.

Name: Physical Access Policy and Procedure - Physical Access Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a physical access policy for implementing physical access controls on offices, rooms and other areas.

Name: Physical Access Policy and Procedure - Physical Access Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should supplement, physical access procedure to implement the protection controls and provides users with specification on physical security safeguards.

Name: Physical Access Policy and Procedure - Authorization for Physical Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enforce formal authorization prior to physical access to any facilities with information processing resources.

Name: Physical Security Controls - Physical Control Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enforce appropriate physical access control perimeters for all physical access points to the entity.

Name: Physical Security Controls - Access to Restricted Areas
Description: Dubai Government Entity should verify and ensures that only authorized employees are provided access to protected areas.

Name: Physical Security Controls - Data Center Entry
Description: Dubai Government Entity should control entry to the data center, or any facility containing information systems using physical access control devices.

Name: Physical Security Controls - Monitor Physical Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should control and monitors physical access to the information processing facilities areas or any other public areas.

Name: Physical Security Controls - Protect Physical Access Devices
Description: Dubai Government Entity should safeguards and enforce adequate protection controls on physical access devices.

Name: Physical Access Policy and Procedure - Inventory of Physical Access Devices
Description: Dubai Government Entity should keep inventory of all physical access devices owned by the entity.

Name: Physical Security Controls - Review Physical Security Access Logs
Description: Dubai Government Entity should review logs of physical access on a regular basis.

Name: Physical Security Controls - Monitor Employee Movement
Description: Dubai Government Entity should deploy mechanism to monitor the movement of employees & non- employees within the entity.

Name: Public and External Party Access Control - External Party logical Access Authorization
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enforce formal authorization prior to logical access required by external party through deploying a "need to know" criteria.

Name: Public and External Party Access Control - Monitor & Log Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should monitor and log logical or physical access provided to public or external party.

Name: Public and External Party Access Control - Control Physical Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should control physical access to any areas that includes information systems and other areas where unauthorized personnel may enter by authenticating visitors before authorizing access.

Name: Public and External Party Access Control - Data Center Access
Description: Dubai Government Entity should authorize, monitor, and control entering and exiting the data center facilities or any other public areas and maintains such records.

Name: Public and External Party Access Control - Physical Access Protection
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set physical access protection and control mechanisms on all external parties or outsourced individuals for any violation of entity's information security policy.

Name: Information and Documents Access Control - Access Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should place adequate security controls on accessing all soft/hard documents/information in alignment with its criticality.

Name: Information and Documents Access Control - Assign Access Rights
Description: Dubai Government Entity should determine and assign the needed access rights for the protected documents/information.

Name: Information and Documents Access Control - Archiving & Retention Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set a clear policy on archiving of documents,  retention period along with procedures and guidelines for the details of implementation and usage.

Name: Information and Documents Access Control - Disposal of Documents
Description: Dubai Government Entity should employ a clear procedure for the disposal of documents, with assigning clear authorization and responsibilities.

Name: Access Control Audit and Review - Audit Trails
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement audit trails in information processing systems, as necessary.

Name: Access Control Audit and Review - Access Review
Description: Dubai Government Entity should log, maintain and periodically review logical and physical access control lists.

Name: Technology and Operations Capacity Management - Capacity Planning
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure advanced planning and preparation for availability of adequate capacity and resources.

Name: Technology and Operations Capacity Management - Capacity Requirements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct an annual projection review of capacity requirements and resources for the information processing systems and their technology components.

Name: Technology and Operations Capacity Management - Standard Operating Procedures
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and maintain operating procedures documentations of all information processing systems detailing inputs, outputs and dependencies.

Name: Technology and Operations Capacity Management - Configuration Baselines
Description: Dubai Government Entity should document and maintain up to date baseline configurations manuals of all information processing systems including an inventory of constituent system components.

Name: Technology and Operations Capacity Management - Controls for Operational Procedures
Description: Dubai Government Entity should place adequate security protection controls on the operational procedures with distribution list and permitted users and ensures their availability to authorized users.

Name: Change Management - Change Management Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal documented change management policy defining the process and roles and responsibilities of business owners.

Name: Change Management - Change Management Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should supplement the policy with a detailed procedure for implementation of the change and configuration management process and provide guidelines for all users.

Name: Change Management - Change Description
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement a change management process that include, as a minimum: 
 A. Description of required change

Name: Change Management - Testing Change Plans
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement a change management process that include, as a minimum: 
 B. Testing and implementation plans

Name: Change Management - Risk Assessment for Changes
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement a change management process that include, as a minimum:                                                                                
 C. Risk assessment of the change impact

Name: Change Management - Authorization for Changes
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement a change management process that include, as a minimum:                                                                        
 D. Official authorization of the change

Name: Change Management - Rollback Plans
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should implement a change management process that include, as a minimum:                                                                               
 E. Rollback process for recovery of unsuccessful changes

Name: Segregation of Duties
Description: Dubai Government Entity should segregate duties and responsibilities as necessary through distributing the tasks among multiple users, in a manner to reduce errors, fraud and unauthorized modification or misuse of the entitys assets.

Name: Separation of Operational Facilities - Segregation of development, testing, and environmental facilities
Description: Dubai Government Entity should segregate where necessary development, testing and production processing facilities to mitigate the risk from unauthorized or unintentional access or change.

Name: Separation of Operational Facilities - Allocation of a secure environment
Description: Dubai Government Entity should allocate secured computing environment for the sensitive and critical information systems facilities.

Name: Information Systems Deployment - Acquisition and deployment policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal policy and procedure for the acquisition, deployment and upgrade of information systems, addressing security controls.

Name: Information Systems Deployment - Acceptance Criteria for New Systems
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define and implement proper acceptance criteria for new information systems implementation and upgrades, and enforcing formal certification and accreditation process outlining security requirements.

Name: Information Systems Deployment - Security Testing
Description: Dubai Government Entity should carry out suitable security testing of the information systems during development and prior to acceptance and deployment, and ensures periodic testing.

Name: Virtualization Techniques
Description: Dubai Government Entity should employ virtualization techniques, whenever applicable, with proper security controls, in reducing the likelihood of successful security attacks.

Name: External Party Services Management - External Party Agreement
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, and maintain a formal agreement with the external party service providers that addresses compliance with the entity information security requirements.

Name: External Party Services Management - SLAs
Description: Dubai Government Entity should place adequate measures to assure that security controls, services definitions and delivery levels that are agreed are implemented and followed by the external party.

Name: External Party Services Management - Monitor Services
Description: Dubai Government Entity should monitor, review and audit the services and all related deliverables provided by external party in a regular basis.

Name: External Party Services Management - Third Party Risks
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should place adequate measures to manage and asses risks related to changes of the external party services.
Examples of changes may include:
A. Application of new or enhanced security controls.
B. Updating entitys policies/procedures.
C. New technology or new vendor to be used.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal policy covering the requirements for prevention, detection and recovery controls against malicious codes.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Awareness
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct regular awareness across the entity on the importance of protecting the entity infrastructure from malicious code attacks.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Implementation of a Solution
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement a proper entity wide system/software for the malicious code scanning, detection and repairing.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Up to Date Malicious Code Protection
Description: Dubai Government Entity should keep an up to date malicious code protection mechanisms which are continuously updated.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Periodic Scans
Description: Dubai Government Entity should perform periodic scans of all information systems and real time scans of files from external sources as defined by the implemented policies.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Automate Antivirus Configurations & Updates
Description: Dubai Government Entity should automate the antivirus software configurations, updates and operations among all users and employees.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Establish Channels for Latest Malware information
Description: Dubai Government Entity should establish and maintain appropriate informative communication channels to obtain latest details of new malicious code.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Continuity Plans
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and implement proper continuity plans/procedures for recovery from malicious code attacks.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Mobile Code Technologies
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define the acceptable and unacceptable mobile code technologies.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Mobile Code Technologies Usage
Description: Dubai Government Entity should establish formal usage restrictions and implementation guides for the acceptable mobile code technologies.

Name: Protection against Malicious and Mobile Code - Mobile Code Technologies Authorization
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enforce formal authorization, monitoring and control over the use of mobile code technologies.

Name: Network Security - Network Services Process
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement formal process for its network services to govern the interconnections between its network and critical owned business information systems and other networks etc.

Name: Network Security - Network Service Agreements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and implement network service agreements and ensures that all required security controls, service levels, and management requirements are addressed.

Name: Network Security - Clock Synchronization
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enable clock synchronization on all networking devices and continuously monitor its accuracy.

Name: Network Security - Monitor Connections
Description: Dubai Government Entity should monitor the information system connections continuously and always verifies enforcement of security requirements.

Name: Network Security - Secure Network Routing
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement secure network routing controls.

Name: Network Security - Protection of Transmitted Information
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement adequate protection level for the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.

Name: Network Security - Termination of Network Connections
Description: Dubai Government Entity should terminate network connections associated with communication sessions as per the entity defined time period of inactivity.

Name: Network Security - Network Availability
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement measures to ensure adequate/high level of network availability.

Name: Network Security - Change Management
Description: Dubai Government Entity should configure the network traffic devices on a need basis, with maintaining logs of all changes as per the entity's change management policy.

Name: Network Security - Documentation
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and maintain full documentation of the network devices, connections, and IP configuration while ensuring protection and controls on the documents.

Name: Network Security - Logging & Monitoring Procedures
Description: Dubai Government Entity should apply appropriate logging and monitoring procedures to enable recording of network security activities.

Name: Information Exchange - Policy & Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain formal policy and procedures governing the exchange of information internally or externally , in line with the classification level.

Name: Information Exchange - Information Exchange Agreements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and maintain formal information exchange agreements for the exchange of any government related information between the entity and any external party.

Name: Information Exchange - Physical Media Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should apply adequate security controls specifically for transmitted physical media containing information such as labelling, liability, etc.

Name: Electronic Messaging/Emails - Electronic Communication Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal electronic communication policy that governs the use of all electronic messaging/email tools provided to the users, outlining the risks associated with it.

Name: Electronic Messaging/Emails - Security of Electronic messages
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement mechanism to ensure confidentiality, integrity and appropriate availability of electronic messaging/emails.

Name: Electronic Messaging/Emails - Disclaimer
Description: Dubai Government Entity should deploy a process of stamping a mandatory disclaimer for electronic messaging/emails.

Name: Electronic Messaging/Emails - Archival & Retention Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should deploy an archival and retention policy for electronic messaging/emails.

Name: Electronic Messaging/Emails - Authentication Mechanisms
Description: Dubai Government Entity should deploy advanced authentication mechanisms for access to electronic messaging/emails from non-trusted networks and public networks.

Name: Electronic Messaging/Emails - Non-repudiation
Description: Dubai Government Entity should deploy non-repudiation supporting advanced encryption mechanisms (e.g. digital signatures) while exchanging critical and sensitive government information.

Name: Online Transactions Controls - Security of Online Transactions
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement adequate confidentiality, integrity and availability controls over any online transactional information/services.

Name: Online Transactions Controls - Agreements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and implement the required agreements with any involved party in managing the online transactions services, and ensures the inclusion of trading terms, details of authorization, liabilities, etc.

Name: Public Information - Integrity of Public Information
Description: Dubai Government Entity should protect the integrity of public information that is available on publicly accessible channels or systems, using  appropriate authentication and access controls, based on  business requirements and applicable legal obligations.

Name: Public Information - Compliance with Laws & Regulations
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure compliance of information published by employees on behalf of the government entity with applicable laws, rules and regulations and approves the publication by an authorized management body within Dubai Government Entity.

Name: Media Handling Management
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement adequate security and protection procedures for any type of media containing information, in terms of handling, storage, disposal, etc.

Name: Monitoring and Logs Management - Audit Logs
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enable audit logs for all information processing systems/applications, and periodically reviews such logs and ensures applying adequate retention measures over them.

Name: Monitoring and Logs Management - Monitoring Requirements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set adequate monitoring requirements for all information systems/applications based on criticality of the systems.

Name: Monitoring and Logs Management - Administrator and Operator Activities
Description: Dubai Government Entity should log system administrators and operators activities and ensures reviewing them periodically, by an independent unit.

Name: Monitoring and Logs Management - Fault Logging
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enable fault logging on all system levels including network, applications, servers and databases among others.

Name: Monitoring and Logs Management - Log Analysis
Description: Dubai Government Entity should deploy adequate logs analysis mechanism and places appropriate actions on faults.

Name: Monitoring and Logs Management - Secure Logging Systems
Description: Dubai Government Entity should secure, where appropriate, logging systems and log files against unauthorized changes including alterations, deletions, and renaming of log file contents, dates and time stamps.

Name: Monitoring and Logs Management - Log Life Time
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set an appropriate life time for maintaining the logging information.

Name: Monitoring and Logs Management - Clock Synchronization
Description: Dubai Government Entity should enable clock synchronization over all information processing systems/applications with accurate time source.

Name: Business Impact Analysis - Conduct BIA
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and periodically conduct a business impact analysis for all information systems and processes in order to define and determine the impact of potential operational failures.

Name: Business Impact Analysis - BIA Responsibility
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set and account the responsibility of the Business Impact Analysis to the senior management, with involvement from all affected divisions.

Name: Business Continuity Plan - Responsibility of BCP
Description: Dubai Government Entity should organize and account responsible a committee of senior management and business owners for the business continuity plan, with defined and clear responsibilities.

Name: Business Continuity Plan - Based on BIA & RA
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should develop, maintain and periodically test and reassess a business continuity plan that covers:
A-The plan should be based on the Business Impact Analysis and Risk Assessment.

Name: Business Continuity Plan - Resilience Requirements
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should develop, maintain and periodically test and reassess a business continuity plan that covers:
B-The plan should address requirements for resilience, alternative processing and recovery capability of all critical business and IT services.

Name: Business Continuity Plan - Communication Processes
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should develop, maintain and periodically test and reassess a business continuity plan that covers:
C-The plan should cover usage guidelines, roles and responsibilities, procedures, communication processes, and the testing approach.

Name: Business Continuity Plan - Reduce Impact of Disruption
Description: Dubai Government Entity should design a business continuity process in a manner to reduce the impact of a major disruption on key business functions and processes.

Name: Disaster Recovery - Critical Systems
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify the most critical business systems and applications in accordance with the risk assessment conducted by the entity.

Name: Disaster Recovery - Recovery Plan
Description: Dubai Government Entity should deploy a proper recovery plan for the identified critical business systems, as the entity's operations specify.

Name: Disaster Recovery - Recovery Scheme
Description: Dubai Government Entity should determine the type of recovery scheme that is applicable for its requirement.

Name: Disaster Recovery - Exercises & Testing
Description: Dubai Government Entity should exercise and periodically test the decided recovery plan.

Name: Disaster Recovery - Disaster Recovery Site
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement disaster recovery sites in case their business systems result in a major loss for the whole government, through using an effective approach based on feasibility studies.

Name: Backup and Storage Policy and Procedure - Backup, Storage, and Retention Policy
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal documented backup, storage and retention policy that includes users' responsibilities, protection controls, legal and business related backup and recovery requirements etc. (e.g. recovery point objective, recovery
time objective, etc.).

Name: Backup and Storage Policy and Procedure - Backup Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should supplement, as necessary, the backup policy with a detailed procedure for backup and storage specifications and implements them.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Media Protection Policy & Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal documented policy and procedure on media library protection.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Access to Media
Description: Dubai Government Entity should restrict and continuously monitor access to media libraries and storage resources.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Mark Media & Storage
Description: Dubai Government Entity should mark clearly all media and storage resources, indicating distribution lists, handling controls, and the application asset's security classification as per policy.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Storage of Backup Media
Description: Dubai Government Entity should allocate proper locations, with adequate security and environmental measures and controls for the storage of the backup media, whether onsite/offsite.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Security Agreements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set security agreements and proper security protection controls in case an external party is involved in handling the media library for the entity.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Physical Media in Transit
Description: Dubai Government Entity should protect and control all physical media while being in a transit process.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Backup Encryption
Description: Dubai Government Entity should encrypt backups and archive where technically feasible and appropriate.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Accountability for Media in Transit
Description: Dubai Government Entity should maintain accountability for media in transit outside the entity control areas and restricts to authorized personnel.

Name: Media Library and Resources Protection - Disposal of Media
Description: Dubai Government Entity should wipe and sanitize all backup media prior to disposal or reuse.

Name: Backup Testing Restoration
Description: Dubai Government Entity should plan and execute a periodic testing and restoration process of all backup and storage media.

Name: Business Continuity Plan (BCP) Test and Review
Description: Dubai Government Entity should maintain, exercise and test in a periodic manner the Business Continuity Plan, Business Impact Analysis, Backup and Restoration, and Disaster Recovery Plan.

Name:
Information Systems Acquisition, Development and
Management Policy and Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal documented policy and procedures for addressing the entitys security requirements on any in house developed or external party applications.

Name: Application Development - SDLC Methodology
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop a System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology and officially incorporates information security requirements within it.

Name: Application Development - Secure Development Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define, distribute and maintain a formal procedure for secure deployment, distribution, provisioning and decommissioning of portable computing device applications, application interfaces (APIs) (including third party components), through regular updates / checks to ensure adequate level of security.

Name: Information Systems Security Requirements and Specifications - Information Security Requirements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define and document information security requirements in all business cases, requests for proposals and work requests, for acquired or in house developed information  systems.

Name: Information Systems Security Requirements and Specifications - Information System Design
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop and approve the information systems design documents addressing the security requirements.

Name: Information Systems Security Requirements and Specifications - Secure Coding Standards
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop the secure coding standards for information systems software development.

Name: Information Systems Security Requirements and Specifications - Security Architecture
Description: Dubai Government Entity should design the security architecture for the development & deployment of information systems.

Name: Information Systems Security Requirements and Specifications - Configuration Management
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement adequate configuration management process during information systems design, development, implementation and operation.

Name: Secure and Correct Processing of Information Systems - Testing
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct proper testing to validate integrity of data input controls on information systems/applications.

Name: Secure and Correct Processing of Information Systems - Validation Checks
Description: Dubai Government Entity should integrate validation checks into information systems/applications processing to detect and any loss of integrity in processed information.

Name: Secure and Correct Processing of Information Systems - Integrity Requirements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify integrity requirements in the information systems/applications and ensures implementing adequate controls to protect it.

Name: Secure and Correct Processing of Information Systems - Data Output Integrity
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct proper testing to validate integrity of data output from information systems/applications.

Name: Securing Information Systems Files, Source Codes and Data - Software Installation Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement restrictive information system procedures on the installation of software in the operational information systems environments.

Name: Securing Information Systems Files, Source Codes and Data - Protecting of Test Data
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper protection controls on the use of testing data.

Name: Securing Information Systems Files, Source Codes and Data - Access to Source Code
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper access control procedures on information systems/application source codes.

Name: Managing Changes in Software Development - Change Management
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper change management controls on the software development processes.

Name: Managing Changes in Software Development - Test & Verify
Description: Dubai Government Entity should test and verify the operational status of all information systems/applications after implementing any change.

Name: Managing Changes in Software Development - Changes to Software Packages
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper control to limit the risk of changes to software packages.

Name: Managing Changes in Software Development - Data Leakage Prevention
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper control to prevent information leakage in all information system/application environments.

Name: Managing Changes in Software Development - Outsourced Software Development Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper security controls on outsourced software development.

Name: Security Testing - Technical Security Reviews
Description: Dubai Government Entity should perform technical security reviews and vulnerability tests  against latest threats and vulnerabilities.

Name: Security Testing - Code Review
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct periodic code reviews on all information systems/applications developed in house or by an external party.

Name: Deployment of Information Systems / Applications - Release & Deployment
Description: Dubai Government Entity should deploy the information systems/ applications into production environment after successful completion of testing & fixing of defects identified.

Name: Deployment of Information Systems / Applications - Security Sign Off
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement security sign off process to confirm the proper implementation of security controls on all information systems/applications prior to deployment.

Name: Cryptography Controls - Cryptography Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a policy on the use of cryptography and key management wherever applicable

Name: Cryptography Controls - Key Management
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper cryptography and key management mechanisms as required by the entity.

Name: Cryptography Controls - Protection of Cryptographic Keys
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper protection and security controls on all cryptographic keys used by the entity.

Name: Environmental/Physical Threats Protection Policy and Procedure - Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute, and maintain a formal,  policy that addresses the entity's requirements for placing environmental protection controls.

Name: Environmental/Physical Threats Protection Policy and Procedure - Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should supplement the environmental threats protection policy with a formal procedure to facilitate implementation of the environmental threats protection policy.

Name: Protection from Environmental Threats - Environmental Threat Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement adequate protection controls against environmental threats, such as fire, floods, earthquakes, etc.

Name: Protection from Environmental Threats - Humidity & Temperature Level Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should control humidity and temperature level on information processing facilities, and continuously monitors it.

Name: Protection from Environmental Threats - Fire Suppression
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper fire suppression and detection systems.

Name: Protection from Environmental Threats - Water Leakage Monitoring
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper control for monitoring water leakage at the physical information processing facilities.

Name: Secure Working Areas - Physical Security Controls
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement adequate physical security mechanisms on offices, data centers, and other working areas, based on criticality of such areas.

Name: Secure Working Areas - Physical Security Awareness
Description: Dubai Government Entity should provide employees with proper guidelines and awareness on the implemented protection controls in the working areas.

Name: Secure Working Areas - Clear Desk & Clear Screen Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a clear desk and clear screen policy that addresses users' responsibilities on securing desks, working areas, and electronic user devices.

Name: Secure Working Areas - Delivery & Loading Areas
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper security controls over delivery and loading areas.

Name: Securing Equipment - Protection of Equipment
Description: Dubai Government Entity should place information systems related equipment in secure and protected locations.

Name: Securing Equipment - Cable Protection
Description: Dubai Government Entity should protect power equipment and cabling of information processing facilities from damages.

Name: Securing Equipment - UPS
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement UPS (uninterruptable power supply) systems to avoid power failures where deemed necessary.

Name: Securing Equipment - Maintenance Procedures
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper maintenance procedures on all information processing facilities.

Name: Securing Equipment - Protection of Equipment Offsite
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper protection controls over equipment and information processing facilities residing off site.

Name: Securing Equipment - Disposal & Re-use of Equipment
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement adequate security controls on the disposal or re-use of any equipment or information processing facility.

Name: Periodic Testing
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct proper testing and assessment periodically over all implemented environmental and physical protection controls.

Name: Prior to Employment Security Controls - Roles & Responsibilities
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define security roles and responsibilities of employees, contractors and outsourced employees in line with Information Security policy.

Name: Prior to Employment Security Controls - Job Descriptions
Description: Dubai Government Entity should document security roles and responsibilities in the job descriptions and objectives of all employees, contractors and outsourced employees.

Name: Prior to Employment Security Controls - Screening
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct proper screening and background verification for all employment candidates according to the applicable laws and policies of Dubai Government.

Name: Prior to Employment Security Controls - Employment Contracts
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure that all employment contracts define security obligations of employees, contractors and outsourced employees, and that approved candidates read and agree such obligations.

Name: Prior to Employment Security Controls - Awareness in Induction Programs
Description: Dubai Government Entity should incorporate Information Security Awareness as part of induction programs of newly hired employees, contractors and outsourced. Employees.

Name: During Employment Security Controls - Enforcing Compliance
Description: Dubai Government Entity should account the senior management responsible for enforcing compliance of their employees,3rd parties to the entity information security policies and procedures.

Name: During Employment Security Controls - Disciplinary Process
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set a clear and defined disciplinary action for employees,  3rd parties who may breach information security policies and procedures.

Name: During Employment Security Controls - Continuous Awareness
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure that all employees, contractors and outsourced employees are provided with information security awareness programs on a regular basis.

Name: Termination/Change of Employment Security controls - Controls for Termination & Change of Employment
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper security controls on the process of terminating or changing employment.

Name: Termination/Change of Employment Security controls - Responsibilities After Termination
Description: Dubai Government Entity should communicate termination responsibilities to the terminated employee in relation to confidentiality agreements and employment contracts.

Name: Termination/Change of Employment Security controls - Returning Assets
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement a process for returning all entity's assets upon termination of employment.

Name: Termination/Change of Employment Security controls - Revoking Access or Change of Access Rights
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement a process for revoking or changing access rights and privileges upon termination or change of employment.

Name: Compliance with Federal and Local Government Legal Requirements - Electronic Commerce & Transactions Law
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should ensure compliance with the following laws and regulations:
A. Federal Law No. 1 of Year 2006 on Electronic Commerce and Transactions.

Name: Compliance with Federal and Local Government Legal Requirements - IT Crime Law
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should ensure compliance with the following laws and regulations:
B. Federal Law No. 2 Year 2006 on the Prevention of Information Technology Crimes.

Name: Compliance with Federal and Local Government Legal Requirements - Electronic Commerce Law
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should ensure compliance with the following laws and regulations:
C. Transactions and electronic commerce Law No. 2 issued in Year 2002 by Dubai Government.

Name: Compliance with Federal and Local Government Legal Requirements - ISR
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should ensure compliance with the following laws and regulations: 
D. The Executive Council of Dubai Government Resolution Number (13) issued in Year 2012 for Information Security Regulation.

Name: Compliance with Federal and Local Government Legal Requirements - HR Law
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should ensure compliance with the following laws and regulations:
E. The Government of Dubai Human Resources Management Law No. (27) of 2006 and its amendment.

Name: Compliance Controls - Applicable Laws & Regulations
Description: Dubai Government Entity should identify the laws or regulations that are applicable to the entitys scope of services.

Name: Compliance Controls - IPR Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) policy that defines the legal obligations pertaining to the use of information assets.

Name: Compliance Controls - Compliance with IPR
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure compliance with Intellectual Property Rights (e.g. software license agreements).

Name: Compliance Controls - Copyright
Description: Dubai Government Entity should prohibit employees from manipulating, making or distributing unauthorized copies of copyrighted/licensed materials, software or applications.

Name: Compliance Controls - Protection of Information Assets & Records
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement proper protection controls for the storage, retention and disposal of entitys information assets and records.

Name: Protection of Private Information of Individuals and Corporates - Privacy Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a privacy policy that addresses the legal requirements for the prevention of misuse of personal information of the entity's customers.

Name: Protection of Private Information of Individuals and Corporates - Privacy Procedure
