Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal procedure detailing the protection measures required for the processing of private data and information.

Name: Protection of Private Information of Individuals and Corporates - Awareness
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct continuous awareness sessions on the requirements of protecting private data and information for the responsible personnel.

Name: Protection of Private Information of Individuals and Corporates - Access to Personal & Private Data
Description: Dubai Government Entity should restrict, minimize and monitor access to personal and private data, and applies proper controls, which should be on "a need-to-know" basis.

Name: Protection of Private Information of Individuals and Corporates - Accountability Procedures
Description: Dubai Government Entity should set proper accountability procedures in the event of any private information and personal data leakage.

Name: Compliance with Information Security Policies and Standards - Periodic Compliance Reviews
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct periodic reviews to verify compliance of the implemented information security policies and procedures.

Name: Compliance with Information Security Policies and Standards - Periodic Technical Reviews
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct periodic technical reviews on information systems to verify compliance of the security standards.

Name: Audit of Information Security Regulation Implementation
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct audit internally to verify effectiveness of the implementation of Information Security Regulation on periodic basis.

Name: Information Security Key Performance Indicators - KPIs
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should develop, select and implement a set of Information Security Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that are: 
A. In support of the government entity strategic and operational planning processes.
B. Integrated into the annual reporting.  
C. Defined to assist in monitoring compliance with the Information Security Regulation. 
D. Reviewed regularly and as an assessment of information security program posture and operational risks. 
E. Used to address issues and deficiencies and take corrective actions.  
F. Built from inputs of a variety of entity's stakeholders and continuous monitoring. 
G. Yielding quantifiable information for comparison purposes.  
H. Measured over consistent and repeatable information security processes.

Name: Information Security Key Performance Indicators - Integrate KPIs in Business Processes
Description: Dubai Government Entity should integrate information security measurements and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in entitys business processes and process owners achieve such measures.

Name: Information Security Key Performance Indicators - Approval of KPIs
Description: Dubai Government Entity should approve the entitys information security measurements and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) by the higher management of the entity.

Name: Information Security Key Performance Indicators - Review Information Security Measurements
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct periodic reviews on the results of information security measurements.

Name: Information Security Key Performance  - Record Actions Impacting ISR Performance
Description: Dubai Government Entity should record actions and events that could have an impact on the effectiveness or performance of the Information Security Regulation.

Name: Information Security Dashboard
Description: Dubai Government Entity should implement, an integrated dashboard for security KPIs to be reviewed and monitored in a periodic manner, by the senior management and the responsible stakeholders.

Name: Cloud Security Policy / Procedure - Cloud Security Policy
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a formal cloud security policy that addresses the entitys requirements for overall cloud management process and outlines roles and responsibilities of relevant stakeholders.

Name: Cloud Security Policy / Procedure - Cloud Security Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should develop, distribute and maintain a cloud security procedure that provides implementation details for establishing and managing secured cloud service environment.

Name: Cloud Security Policy / Procedure - Review of Cloud Security Policy & Procedure
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct periodic reviews of cloud security policy and procedure or if significant changes occur to ensure their continuing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness.

Name: Data Location
Description: Dubai Government Entity should prevent handling and storing classified data with a Cloud Service Provider (CSP), outside the legal jurisdiction or geographical boundaries of the United Arab Emirates, including for CSPs Backup or Disaster Recovery purposes.

Name: Data Classification and Handling
Description: Dubai Government Entity should define and communicate required security controls to Cloud Service Provider (CSP) for handling of data in accordance to the applicable laws & regulations (in line with ISR Ref. 11.1 and 11.2).

Name: Architecture and Deployment Model
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure adequate cloud security controls are implemented by Cloud Service Provider (CSP) as per architecture and deployment model approved by the entity.

Name: Service Agreements - Ownership Rights
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure through a formal agreement that the Cloud Service Provider (CSP) has no ownership rights on the stored data regardless of the format or storage medium.

Name: Service Agreements - Formal Agreement
Description:
Dubai Government Entity should develop and maintain a formal agreement with Cloud Service Provider (CSP) addressing the following information security requirements as a minimum: 
A. Information security risks and mitigation 
B. Data protection and storage 
C. Information security incidents handling 
D. Change, Recovery and Restoration

Name: Data Portability and Continuity - Data Portability
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure that Cloud Service Provider (CSP) has the adequate measures and processes to support data portability whenever the entity decides to moving its data.

Name: Data Portability and Continuity - BC & DR Testing
Description: Dubai Government Entity should ensure proper cloud security controls are implemented by Cloud Service Provider (CSP), addressing entitys requirements for periodic testing of the continuity and disaster recovery plans and communicating the results to entity.

Name: Compliance and Monitoring
Description: Dubai Government Entity should conduct periodic reviews or audits to verify Cloud Service Providers (CSPs) compliance with the applicable security policies and contractual requirements.
